22 Let’s read now Amos 7:10 to close! "Then Amaziah the priest of Bethel sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, Amos hath conspired against thee in the midst of the house of Israel: the land is not able to bear all his words. For thus Amos saith: Jeroboam shall die by the sword, and Israel shall certainly go into captivity out of his land. And Amaziah said unto Amos, Thou Seer, go, flee away into the land of Judah, and eat bread there, and prophesy there. But prophesy not again any more at Bethel; for it is the king's sanctuary, and it is the house of the kingdom." You see? Amos was asked to leave the city while false prophets, false pastors, false teachers and false priests like Amaziah himself were making an exhibition of themselves there! But hundreds of years later, the book of Amos laid beside the scrolls of Moses! Isaiah had been contested, considered by his country as a threat to the public order, national security and international relations, and got finally sawn in pieces; but eight hundred years later, his book was beside the scrolls of Moses. And he that has ears to hear, let him hear!
